title: Mathematics Curriculum Design Workshop for Decolonizing Education and Internalizing Bicultural Principles

context.prior_knowledge: Secondary-level mathematics teaching experience and understanding of basic educational philosophy
context.additional_context: Strengthening mathematics instructional design competencies reflecting the integration of Māori and Western cultures in New Zealand’s higher education context

learning_goals: Participants can develop three or more mathematics curriculum design frameworks reflecting bicultural principles
Participants can identify and propose improvements for two or more biases in existing mathematics curricula from a decolonial perspective
Participants can complete a practical assignment integrating cultural diversity elements into a sustainability strategy framework by applying methodologies acquired in the workshop
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
